result.execSummary:
The defendant Eddie Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 1:22pm [mo]
Defendant Eddie Hudson in court with Attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
recess:1:24pm --reconvene:1:35pm [to allow Atty. Gonzalez to speak with prosecutor assigned to case regarding criminal case settlement]

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1 with Repeater enhancer stricken; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Mr. Hudson indicates he does not wish to be placed on Probation

On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the reapeater enhancer on Count #1

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts #2 and #3

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Gonzalez 
Statement made by Mr. Hudson

On Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for purposes of employment;to be consecutive to any other sentence in being; to commence on May 28, 2015 at 7:00pm
--1 day credit for time already served given
--Mr. Hudson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and alternate, if served, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--to submit DNA sample upon demand by designee
--pay costs of $268 plus 250 DNA surcharge= $518 plus $119 in summons/ subpoena fees= 637.00, to be paid in $75 per month installments commencing on June 30, 2015 and on the 30th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 13 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess:1:58pm

Case called at 10:34 am [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Mark Fremgen presiding for BrII]
Defendant Eddie Hudson in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court quashes warrant
Mr. Hudson indicates that he has Atty Gonzalez in this matter, but Atty Gonzalez was unable to appear today; he did advise to come into Court without him today.
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Hudson indicates that he would like to proceed today without counsel
Upon questioning of ADA Fryatt, Mr. Hudson presents basis for non-appearance
Court reinstates bond as previously set, upon no no objection from the State

Case called at 1:20 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Eddie Hudson appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. Public ServiceSpecial Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that Mr. Hudson qualifies for SPD Services

DOB  & address confirmed accurate; Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties ; but Atty De La Rosa requests matter be set for preliminary hearing

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with DHP (dob: 10/26/1998) or Rachelle Pete; Defendant may return to the residence one time within the next 5 days within the presence of law enforcement to retrieve his personal belongings.
-No acts/threats of violence
-No possession of any dangerous weapons as defined by statute
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-Prints and Photos
Recess: 1:27 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 1/20/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
